Text: There's always been 'bad guys'. Robert the Bruce was a 'bad guy' given he slaughtered the families in the North East (the Comyns). Should we blow up his statue? Or maybe demolish the Wallace monument?
Robert the Bruce cut the throat of his rival John Comyn as he knelt praying at an altar in Dumfries. Surely we must now all be calling for his statue in Stirling to be torn down? Sheer barbarism.
Breaking News: Scottish Unionists spotted at Bannockburn trying to tear down statue of Robert The Bruce.......

Where did i say to erect a Hiter statue? Read it again and you will see i said keep them and educate people on their history. Would you be ok if unionists took Robert the Bruce or William Wallace statues?
Sounds like you support this? So if unionists done that to the Robert the Bruce statue would you also agree? How about they stay up and people get educated on the history of these people?
And whilst we’re at it what about the Robert the Bruce statue up in Stirling - he gave us a right old beating a few years back and I’ve been upset ever since

My concern is with such unofficial action (yes his statue should have gone long ago ) that where does it end... I do not want to see statues of Robert the Bruce, William Wallace & Robert Burns being torn down even Donald Dewar who seems a popular choice on Twitter to go!

Pulling down the statue of a slave owner in Bristol might feel appropriate, but what's next? Churchill? Cromwell? How about Robert the Bruce? He murdered a man in a church. Nelson? Adulterer. Don't pull down statues

It sadly would appear we have fascism alive within the pro Scottish independence movement all i asked was if he would be ok with unionists bring down the Robert the Bruce statue since he was ok with the one in Bristol coming down. Wtf is happening to our side
What's lovely? If unionists tore down the statue of Robert the Bruce would that be ok with you?
If unionists tore down the statue of Robert the Bruce would that have your support?

So you believe that it is the right of any crowd to take down any statue that THEY feel should come down. So for instance a statue of Robert the Bruce would be quite legitimately toppled by unionists ?
#OnThisDay in 1329 Robert the Bruce died. His statue takes pride of place on the castle's drawbridge. This was added in 1929 to mark the 600th anniversary of his death.

I have made a visit to battlefield ~ where a statue of Robert the Bruce stands proudly upon his mount ~ I noticed nobody climbs up & puts a traffic cone on his head like they do on Wellington in the city of Glasgow. Its now included on the city tour. How do they get up there ?
I know I’m from stirling, I meant the Robert the Bruce statue
